com.igormaznitsa.prol.containers
Class KnowledgeBase

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.containers.KnowledgeBase

public final class KnowledgeBase
extends java.lang.Object

The class implements the knowledge base for a Prol engine

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

                                          int type)
To get an operator for its name and type

Parameters:

Returns:
the found operator or null if not found
See Also:
Operator

removeOperator

public boolean removeOperator(java.lang.String name,
                              int type)
Remove an operator from the knowledge base, can be used only for dynamic operators which were not added through annotations

Parameters:
name - the operator name, must not be null
type - the operator type
Returns:
true if the operator had been found and removed, else false
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - will be thrown if it is an operator which was not dinamically added
See Also:
Operator

addOperator

public void addOperator(Operator operator)
Add an operator into the knowledge base

Parameters:
operator - an operator, must not be null
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - will be thrown if there is such operator already or there is an operator looks like new one
See Also:
Operator

findOperatorForName

public OperatorContainer findOperatorForName(java.lang.String name)
Find an operator container for name

Parameters:
name - the name of operator, must not be null
Returns:
null if an operator container is not found or the found operator container
See Also:
OperatorContainer

hasOperatorStartsWith

public boolean hasOperatorStartsWith(java.lang.String str)
Check if there is an operator at the base which one starts with a string

Parameters:
str - the string to find an operator, must not be null
Returns:
true if there is an operator starts with the string else false

write

public void write(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
To out all dynamic value of the knowledge into writer in the prolog source format

Parameters:
writer - the writer to be used for the out, must not be null

retractAll

public boolean retractAll(TermStruct clause)
Retract all clauses from the knowledge base compatible with the key clause

Parameters:
clause - the key clause to remove compatible clauses from the base, must not be null
Returns:
true if there is found compatible clauses and removed, else false

retracta

public boolean retracta(TermStruct clause)
Remove the first found compatible clause for a key clause

Parameters:
clause - the key clause, must not be null
Returns:
true if there is found and removed clause, else false

retractz

public boolean retractz(TermStruct clause)
Remove the last found compatible clause for a key clause

Parameters:
clause - the key clause, must not be null
Returns:
true if there is found and removed clause, else false

abolish

public void abolish(java.lang.String signature)
Remove al clauses from the base with a key signature

Parameters:
signature - the signature (as an example "predicate/4") to be used for removing operation

getOperatorIterator

public java.util.Iterator<OperatorContainer> getOperatorIterator()
To get the iterator of all defined operators at the base

Returns:
the iterator of the inside operator table

makeCopy

public KnowledgeBase makeCopy(ProlContext context)
Make copy of the knowledge base, it means that there will be new knowledge base object contains the snapshot of the current knowledge base state. It will copy only structure but new knowledge base will have the same term and rule objects as the etalon

Returns:
new knowledge base instance as the snapshot of current
